metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45939 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GNU Emacs through 28.2 allows attackers to execute commands via shell metacharacters in the name of a source-code file, because lib-src/etags.c uses the system C library function in its implementation of the ctags program. For example, a victim may use the "ctags *" command (suggested in the ctags documentation) in a situation where the current working directory has contents that depend on untrusted input.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45939` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

emacs - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-bin-common - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-common - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-el - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-gtk - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-lucid - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-nox - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: emacs package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1').
xemacs21 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
xemacs21-packages package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
